N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 2 ยง 315.2 - Definitions

State Regulations
(a) As used in this

Part, the term employer shall mean the State, a participating employer, and any
other unit of government or organization obligated or agreeing to make
contributions to the retirement system on behalf of its employees. (b) The term employee shall mean an
individual performing services for the employer for which the employer has the
right to control the means and methods of what work will be done and how the
work will be done. (c) The term
independent contractor shall mean a consultant or other individual engaged to
achieve a certain result who is not subject to the direction of the employer as
to the means and methods of accomplishing the result. For purposes of this

Part, when making a determination as to whether an individual is an employee or
an independent contractor, the factors set forth hereinafter in section
315.3
(c)(2)
of
this Part shall be considered by the employer. Notes
